# King Wen of Chu

|title           =
|reign           = 689–677 BC
|succession      = King of Chu
|predecessor     = King Wu
|successor       = Du'ao
|death_date      = 677 BC
|posthumous name = King Wen (文王)
|house           = Mi
|dynasty         = Chu
|father          = King Wu
|spouse          = Xi Gui (息媯)
|issue           = Du'aoKing ChengWen Mi (文羋)Jiang Mi (江羋)

King Wen of Chu (), personal name Xiong Zi, was from 689 BC to 677 BC the king of the Chu state.
King Wen succeeded his father, King Wu, who died in 690 BC. He died in 677 BC and was succeeded by one of his sons, Du'ao.
